p: On the seventh day (March 27) the patient showed a significant psychomotor agitation along with slight chest discomfort. The daily blood tests showed a significant rise of pro‐coagulant and inflammatory markers d‐Dimer (1,392 ng/ml), white blood count (12,300 μl), PCR (359 mg/L), LDH (761 U/L), ferritin (1,629 ng/ml) along with a significant elevation of high sensitivity troponin I levels (12,990 ng/ml) (Table 1).
